title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranks as the most educated state in the 2026 WalletHub analysis.
Over 47% of Massachusetts adults have a bachelor's degree, with 22% holding graduate or professional degrees.
Vermont and Maryland placed second and third, while Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia ranked lowest.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction — and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A rare T206 Honus Wagner baseball card is up for auction by Goldin Auctions, closing February 21.
The card originally belonged to Morton Bernstein, with ties to Taunton, Massachusetts, remaining ungraded for over 116 years.
Current bidding for the card, plus buyer's premium, stands at $4,758,000, with expectations it could reach $6+ million.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jeremy Swayman will start for Team USA in Saturday's Olympic preliminary round game against Denmark.
Swayman, 27, was pivotal in Team USA's 2025 IIHF World Championship victory with a 5-0 record.
Bruins defenseman Charlie McAvoy will also play for Team USA, alongside Swayman against Denmark.

title: New England Aquarium IDs right whale found dead off Virginia
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: A 3-year-old female North Atlantic right whale was found dead on a Virginia barrier island.
The whale was the 2023 calf of right whale Porcia, marking her third offspring death.
North Atlantic right whales are critically endangered, with only 380 individuals and 72 reproductive females remaining.

title: Another child has died of the flu in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Seven children have died from the flu in Massachusetts this season, according to state health officials.
The Massachusetts Department of Public Health reported 260 total flu-related deaths, including 253 adults.
Flu activity surged in January, straining hospitals, but cases are beginning to decline in February.

title: Mass. police department offers ‘Valentine’s Day Special’ for wanted exes
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Uxbridge Police Department offers Valentine-themed initiative to encourage reporting of exes with outstanding warrants.
The Facebook post features a humorous flyer inviting residents to provide information about ex-partners wanted by police.
The post received nearly 7,000 likes and over 400 comments, with similar initiatives seen in other states.

title: ‘We’ll see how it plays out’: Caleb Durbin, Marcelo Mayer each to practice at 2B, 3B to begin spring training
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Red Sox infielder candidates Caleb Durbin and Marcelo Mayer to practice at 2B and 3B during spring training.
Manager Alex Cora aims to make infield position decisions soon with emphasis on reduced errors from past seasons.
Besides Durbin and Mayer, Romy Gonzalez, Nick Sogard, and Isiah Kiner-Falefa could see time at 2B and 3B.

title: Report: Patriots QBs coach Ashton Grant to stay in New England, won’t take OC interviews
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Patriots QBs coach Ashton Grant will stay in New England and not pursue NFL offensive coordinator interviews.
Grant played a vital role in QB Drake Maye's development, contributing to the Patriots' Super Bowl LX appearance.
Grant, from Manchester, Conn., began his coaching career at Holy Cross and held roles with the Browns before joining the Patriots.

title: Brighton community raises $25k for flooded barbershop
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Brighton community raised over $25,800 through a GoFundMe for Matt's Barber Shop after a burst pipe caused flooding.
Matt's Barber Shop in Brighton flooded due to a tenant turning off heating, resulting in significant water damage.
A benefit show is set for Feb. 19 at O'Brien's Pub, featuring local acts to support Matt's Barber Shop recovery.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Eternity' featuring Elizabeth Olsen streams on Apple TV, exploring a romantic afterlife decision between two husbands.
'Dawson's Creek,' starring the late James Van Der Beek, is available on Netflix, Hulu, and Tubi.
'Love Is Blind' Season 10 continues its unique matchmaking format, now streaming on Netflix.
